title: Improving Rural Health and Telehealth Access

enrichment.summary: This executive order aims to improve healthcare access and quality in rural areas by promoting telehealth services, launching new payment models for rural healthcare providers, investing in rural healthcare infrastructure, and extending telehealth flexibilities beyond the COVID-19 public health emergency. It focuses on addressing unique challenges faced by rural communities, such as hospital closures, provider shortages, and transportation barriers.
potential_concerns: Extending telehealth flexibilities beyond the public health emergency may create reimbursement challenges or exacerbate inequities for rural healthcare providers if payment models do not adequately compensate their costs or patient complexities.

Rural communities might still face barriers to telehealth access due to insufficient broadband infrastructure despite the orderâ€™s calls for investment, limiting the intended improvements in healthcare access.

Healthcare workers in rural areas may experience increased workload or responsibility without commensurate resource support as telehealth services expand, potentially affecting quality of care delivered to patients.

Medicare beneficiaries in rural communities could encounter difficulties if telehealth services are not fully integrated with traditional in-person care or if regulatory changes create confusion around coverage and eligibility.
